Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Stipend \Sti"pend\, n. [L. stipendium; stips, gen. stipis, a gift, donation, given in small coin + pendere to weigh or pay out.] Settled pay or compensation for services, whether paid daily, monthly, or annually. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Stipend \Sti"pend\, v. t. To pay by settled wages. [R.] [1913 Webster]
stipend n : a sum of money allotted on a regular basis; usually for some specific purpose
